content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: CMTRT
      operator: non_empty
    - name: CMDECOD
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0096
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when CMTRT is populated, CMDECOD is empty
Outcome:
  Message: CMDECOD must be populated when CMTRT is populated
  Output Variables:
    - CMTRT
    - CMDECOD
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0096
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: CMDECOD is the standardized medication/therapy term
                  derived by the sponsor from  the coding dictionary. It is expected
                  that the reported term (CMTRT) or the modified term (CMMODIFY) will
                  be coded using a standard dictionary
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2c
                Section: 6.1.2
              - Cited Guidance: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description
                  of CMTRT or CMMODIFY.  Equivalent to the generic medication name
                  in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name
                  and version used to map  the terms utilizing the define.xml external
                  codelist attributes. If an intervention term does not have a decode
                  value in the dictionary then  CMDECOD will be left blank.
                Document: IG v3.3
                Item: Specification
                Section: 6.1.2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CM

json.Description: Raise an error when CMTRT is populated, CMDECOD is empty

Outcome.Message: CMDECOD must be populated when CMTRT is populated

Citations.Cited_Guidance: CMDECOD is the standardized medication/therapy term derived by the sponsor from  the coding dictionary. It is expected that the reported term (CMTRT) or the modified term (CMMODIFY) will be coded using a standard dictionary

Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of CMTRT or CMMODIFY.  Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map  the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary then  CMDECOD will be left blank.
